DESCRIPTION: When you have the #y variation, all cards played are considered to be of the same type as the current tempo.
Discover 1 card to add to your hand. This card's energy consumption becomes 0 for the turn and is consumed after use.

Whenever a card is played, gain a layer of #y tempo of that card type NL Playing a card of a different type than the current tempo clears the current #y tempo NL When you have 7 layers of #y tempo, consume 7 layers of #y tempo , gain an extra turn, and go into play!
For each layer of #y gravity you have, damage received is increased by 5%.
Shine will give some of your cards an extra effect.
Goes into an extra turn and triggers the #y playing effect of the Live song . The playing turn inherits the remaining cost from the previous turn and gains an additional [E] .

Name and Reputation:Gain 20 block points by clearing negative effects. NL Potential Indication:Gain 2 Strength and 2 Agility. NL Beyoncé Walk:Gain [E] [E] NL Draw 2 cards . NL Cutting Line:Gain 2 new dots. NL 壱雫空: Gives all enemies 5 levels of Weakness and Vulnerability. NL Shadow Dance: Gain a block equal to the unblocked damage dealt. NL Kasuga Shadow:Stun all enemies NL Shishoujou: Double the damage of all your attacks . NL Tone One Momo: Gain Barrier, gain 20 block points .

The Void-White Trio +1 Strength +1 Agility per play; if Gravity and Shine are not equal in number, "I love you, what's it to you?" There is a 50% chance of drawing one less card when played, and a 50% chance of triggering one less cost reduction.

The Void White Trio removes all "in readiness" each time it plays the Guitar - Asakusa & Shimmering Dew triggers; if all three revues have been played, foresee 5 each time it gets a performance ready.

The Void-White Trio applies 2 levels of gravity and 4 levels of entanglement to the entire enemy field each time it is played; "Destroy you, and what have you to do with it?" No longer gains artifacts when played.
Triggers additional effects when there is only 1 song in the song list.
